instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 No power
threads.message:
Hi!

No power, no fan spin.

Board looks in good shape, no corrosion.

PPDCIN_G3H 20v
PP3V_G3H 3v
PPBUS_G3H 12.7v
PP3V3_G3H 3.3v
PP3V3_S5 3.3v
L7030 12.6v
L7230 0v
L7210 0V
L7430 0V
L8102 0.995 V

I don't know what else to measure. thanks

threads.title: 820-01521 No power
threads.message:
How the failure appeared?

Do you get voltage at L7290?
Also check U8210/20/40 output voltage.

You should try DFU.

threads.title: 820-01521 No power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 100635, member: 682"]
How the failure appeared?

Do you get voltage at L7290?
Also check U8210/20/40 output voltage.

You should try DFU.
[/QUOTE]



How the failure appeared? 
R/ I just got it like that. no signs of life.

L7290   0V

U8240  
pin 1   0V
pin2    0v   
pin3   0v
pin4    0v
pin5    0v
pin 6    0v
pin 7     0.250 
pin 8     0.0
the reason im showing a picture edited with voltages is because on the Board view the ic's have 2 pads less.

im not sure how to DFU

threads.title: 820-01521 No power
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]

I said to check output voltage on the 3 mentioned chips; not checking all the pins!
